Dr. Ceorgianna Rose Simpson,
of Columbia who near the professor
German at University died the 9th Of January 1914
She was frequent the Douglass home in Anacosta
She was born Columbia about years
ago. the daughter of David Catherine Simpson.


She was educated public the District of Columbia
the Normal School, under the late Dr. Lucy E.
Moten Miss teacher the elementary schools
the District 1885, Having proted by her oppor
study German by contact with Germans In the United
States encouraged by Dr. Lucy Mote to study the IAN
guage and literature in Germany she spent year ana nan
remained longer had not the serious
mother necessiated her return to the United States
Miss Simpson kept her interest in her CHOSEN e ana
teaching she passed summers abroad she had then
in German at the M street gn SCHOOL, e
known Dunbar High School.


To herself for greater usefulness Simpson attended
sessions Harvard College and the University
Chicago minor field French language ana
literature. Chicago she obtained the Bachelor degree ana then
School, After hard study and panstan re-
search Chicago the degree OF Doctor OF hlo-
souv 1921 work instructor modern
languages High School, but her increased pesge
and ability public that Howard On1ver-
s called her to prossoshp institution in 1881 There
creab instructor In her chosen eo Until sne
reached the age limit and retired in 1882


Simpson enthusiastic advocate OF e STUDY OF
culture So much during the first World War the witch
gnorany charged her with being Sne was
investigated loyalty the wiseacres could no
nothing had said and done except to evalue e
the German people She had no interest In or admra
ton and Hitler machines which brought the country
to RUM Simpson showed her wisdom upbraiding Americans
for their study German language because OF the war
histeria I9149l9 Instead Of refusing study further the Ian
guage Of the enemy that was the very time to make serious S
Of that tongue. 49,.

NEGRO HISTORY NOTES


DIR, GEORGIANFIA SIMPSON

NEW YORK Music Of 18th
and 10Th century Russian COM
posers will be presented by cho-
raj groups from six United Ne
gro College Fund schools in the
opening February program Of the
ABC networks Negro College
Choirs broadcasts. Wiley. Bens-
dict. St. Augustine's. St. Paurs
Philander Smith Colleges and
Tuskegee Institutes Will be heard.


The program originates from
New York on Feb. 2. 1t will be
rebroadcast by affiliated A1C
radio stations. Check your local
newspaper for air time.

NEGRO COLLEGES
TO SING RUSSIAN
MUSIC ON AIR

A mistrial was declared be-
cause a prospective woman jur-
or advised the Judge she had
sat on a jury which previously
considered the defendant s case.


Clifton Douglas, SO, accused
Of felony manslaughter in the fatal
stabbing of his roommate, was
granted a mistrial. Feb. 10 was
set for the new trial by Judge
william Holohan.


Douglas first trial ended last
month with the jury deadlocked.


Douglas is charged with the
Sept. killing Of shall Smith,
81, at l34l W. Papago, where
they shared a room. Police said
they had argued over making cof-
fee.

full articles.headline:
MISTRIAL FOR
CLIFTON DOUGLAS
full articles.article:
A mistrial was declared be-
cause a prospective woman jur-
or advised the Judge she had
sat on a jury which previously
considered the defendant s case.


Clifton Douglas, SO, accused
Of felony manslaughter in the fatal
stabbing of his roommate, was
granted a mistrial. Feb. 10 was
set for the new trial by Judge
william Holohan.


Douglas first trial ended last
month with the jury deadlocked.


Douglas is charged with the
Sept. killing Of shall Smith,
81, at l34l W. Papago, where
they shared a room. Police said
they had argued over making cof-
fee.
